com.continuent.tungsten.fsm.core
Class StateTransitionMap

java.lang.Object
  com.continuent.tungsten.fsm.core.StateTransitionMap

public class StateTransitionMap
extends java.lang.Object

Manages the map of states and transitions composing a finite state machine.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Hodges

Designates a default state to which control transfers if a transition fails with a TransitionFailureException.

Parameters:
state - An error state, which must already have been added to the map
Throws:
FiniteStateException - Thrown if the state cannot be found in the map

parent - A parent state that contains this state if any
entryAction - An action to perform on entering the state

addTransition

public Transition addTransition(java.lang.String name,
                                Guard guard,
                                State input,
                                Action action,
                                State output)
                         throws FiniteStateException
Adds a new transition to the map.

Parameters:
name - Transition name
guard - Condition guarding the transition
input - Input state
action - An action to take when the transition is triggered
output - Output state
Throws:
FiniteStateException

addTransitionGroup

public void addTransitionGroup(java.lang.String name,
                               Guard guard,
                               State[] states,
                               Action action)
                        throws FiniteStateException
Adds a group of transitions to the map that share the same guard and action and that have the same input and output state. The effect of having such a group is to be able to specify an 'event' that fires, via the guard, but that can only 'fire' when the state machine is in one of the states specified. For transitions that are added via this means, the output state is always the same as the input state.

Parameters:
name - Transition name
guard - Condition guarding the transition
states - States in which the transition MAY be taken
action - An action to take when the transition is triggered
Throws:
FiniteStateException

addTransitionGroup

public void addTransitionGroup(java.lang.String name,
                               Guard guard,
                               java.util.Set<State> states,
                               Action action)
                        throws FiniteStateException
Adds a group of transitions to the map that share the same guard and action and that have the same input and output state. The effect of having such a group is to be able to specify an 'event' that fires, via the guard, but that can only 'fire' when the state machine is in one of the states specified. For transitions that are added via this means, the output state is always the same as the input state.

Parameters:
name - Transition name
guard - Condition guarding the transition
states - States in which the transition MAY be taken
action - An action to take when the transition is triggered
Throws:
FiniteStateException

public Transition addTransition(java.lang.String name,
                                java.lang.String regex,
                                State input,
                                Action action,
                                State output)
                         throws FiniteStateException
Adds a new transition to the map with a generated regex guard.

Parameters:
name - Transition name
regex - Regex expression to create RegexGuard
input - Input state
action - An action to take when the transition is triggered
output - Output state
Throws:
FiniteStateException

                                java.lang.Class<?> eventType,
                                State input,
                                Action action,
                                State output)
                         throws FiniteStateException
Adds a new transition to the map with a generated event type guard.

Parameters:
name - Transition name
eventType - Class of event type for EventTypeGuard
input - Input state
action - An action to take when the transition is triggered
output - Output state
Throws:
FiniteStateException

build

public void build()
           throws FiniteStateException
Validates the state machine for use. This must be called prior to any use of the state machine.

Throws:
FiniteStateException

nextTransition

public Transition nextTransition(State inputState,
                                 Event event,
                                 Entity entity)
                          throws FiniteStateException
Computes the next transition given a particular input state and a message delivered to that state.

Parameters:
inputState -
event -
entity -
Returns:
Next transition matching the event
Throws:
TransitionNotFoundException - Thrown if no transition matches or if the map has not been properly initialized by a call to build()
FiniteStateException

nextChainedTransition

public Transition nextChainedTransition(State inputState,
                                        Event event,
                                        Entity entity)
                                 throws FiniteStateException
Computes the next transition that may be chained to a previous transition as the result of changes which cause a given guard's accept to fire. In this case, the transition is not initiated by an event, but by the condition itself. This is, in essence, a chaining operation.

Parameters:
inputState -
entity -
Returns:
Next transition whose guard's accept fires.
Throws:
TransitionNotFoundException - Thrown if no transition matches or if the map has not been properly initialized by a call to build()
FiniteStateException

getTransitionMap

public java.util.Map<State,TransitionMatcher> getTransitionMap()
Gets the transition map

Returns:
the current transition map
